00:00:01:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:01:080000.Dialogue: Yeah, I miss you, too, sweetie. Listen, I got to go, but I'll see you tonight? Okay. Bye-bye. No, you hang up first.

00:00:15:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:15:150000.Dialogue: Dude, I'm glad you finally got a girlfriend, but do you have to do all that lovey-dovey stuff in front of those of us who don't?

00:00:22:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:22:070000.Dialogue: Actually, he might have to. There's an economic concept known as a positional good in which an object is only valued by the possessor because it's not possessed by others. The term was coined in 1976 by economist Fred Hirsch to replace the more colloquial, but less precise "neener-neener."

00:00:38:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:38:200000.Dialogue: That's not true. My happiness is not dependent on my best friend being miserable and alone.

00:00:44:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:44:210000.Dialogue: Although, I'd be lying if I said it wasn't a little bit of a perk.

00:00:49:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:49:220000.Dialogue: Oh. I used to be like that. Then I got a girlfriend.

00:00:58:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:58:090000.Dialogue: Hey, what are you and Bernadette doing for your first Valentine's Day?

00:01:01:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:01:020000.Dialogue: Yeah, I am pulling out all the stops. There's a $39.95 lover's special at P.F. Chang's.

00:01:07:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:07:230000.Dialogue: Egg rolls, dumplings, bottomless wok, and you get your picture taken on the big marble horse out front.

00:01:14:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:14:090000.Dialogue: Given that Saint Valentine was a third century Roman priest who was stoned and beheaded, wouldn't a more appropriate celebration of the evening be taking one's steady gal to witness a brutal murder?

00:01:25:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:25:220000.Dialogue: I understand your point, but given a choice, Jews always go with Chinese food.

00:01:33:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:33:180000.Dialogue: Well, if anyone's interested, I'll be spending this Valentine's Day the same way I spend every Valentine's Day. Buying a rotisserie chicken from the supermarket, taking it home, standing over the sink and eating it out of the package with my bare hands like an animal.

00:01:45:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:45:230000.Dialogue: Okay, so to sum up: one giant marble horse, one asinine comment, one lonely man and his chicken. And let's see. Who's left? Oh, that's right. My plans.

00:02:03:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:03:140000.Dialogue: Fine, tell us you're going to have sex with Penny.

00:02:05:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:05:090000.Dialogue: That's not what I was going to tell you.

00:02:07:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:07:020000.Dialogue: It's okay. I don't mind hearing about your sex life. It's his that bugs me.

00:02:13:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:13:160000.Dialogue: Guess who the university is sending to Switzerland to attend a conference and see the CERN supercollider on February 14?

00:02:20:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:20:200000.Dialogue: Professor Norton, although, God knows why. He hasn't published anything of note since he won that Nobel Prize.

00:02:26:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:26:100000.Dialogue: Actually, Professor Norton can't make it. He threw his back out rock climbing.

00:02:29:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:29:140000.Dialogue: I heard he threw his back out climbing on his new girlfriend.

00:02:32:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:32:110000.Dialogue: The big-boobed weather girl on Channel 2?

00:02:34:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:34:230000.Dialogue: In any case, they're asking me to fill in for him.

00:02:38:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:38:130000.Dialogue: In Switzerland or with the bi g-boobed weather girl?

00:02:41:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:41:110000.Dialogue: Switzerland. And I get to bring a guest!

00:02:47:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:47:040000.Dialogue: This is incredible! I'm so happy, I'm not even going to question their judgment in picking you. I'm just going to run home and start packing.

00:03:03:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:03:210000.Dialogue: Oh. Well, then I anticipate an awkward situation when you get home.

00:03:41:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:41:190000.Dialogue: Of course, my good friend. Come in. Help me out. Which ski hat says aprÃ¨s supercollider?

00:03:52:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:52:170000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm not taking you to Switzerland.

00:03:55:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:55:100000.Dialogue: Well, of course you are. Who else would you take?

00:03:59:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:59:100000.Dialogue: What? That's absurd. Penny has no interest in subatomic particle research.

00:04:04:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:04:230000.Dialogue: Yes, but it'll be Valentine's Day. We can go sightseeing and skiing and make love in front of a roaring fire in the shadow of the snowcapped Alps.

00:04:14:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:14:230000.Dialogue: But Penny has no interest in subatomic particle research.

00:04:22:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:22:020000.Dialogue: Sorry? I've been dreaming about going to the Large Hadron Collider since I was nine years old.

00:04:27:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:27:190000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, I've been dreaming about spending Valentine's Day with a girl since I was six.

00:04:32:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:32:200000.Dialogue: Shame on you! That's no dream for a scientist!

00:04:41:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:41:200000.Dialogue: Just a minute. This tray contains clues as to what you and I are going to be doing on Valentine's Day.

00:04:50:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:50:020000.Dialogue: Oh. Wow. Okay. Let's see. We've got, uh, milk chocolate, Swiss cheese, fondue. My lactose-intolerant boyfriend is going to eat all this. Then I'm going to climb on his back and rocket to the moon?

00:05:13:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:13:030000.Dialogue: But it does involve air travel. Okay, um... let me slice this Swiss cheese with my Swiss army knife, and then you can wash it down with a cup of Swiss Miss instant cocoa.

00:05:31:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:31:120000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm starting to think Swiss is key here.

00:05:36:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:36:190000.Dialogue: We're going to Disneyland and ride the Matterhorn?

00:05:42:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:42:040000.Dialogue: How does that involve air travel?

00:05:44:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:44:040000.Dialogue: We're going to Disney World and ride the Matterhorn?

00:05:50:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:50:170000.Dialogue: Okay, sweetie, this started out fun, but I'm over it.

00:05:53:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:53:210000.Dialogue: We're going to Switzerland to see the CERN supercollider!

00:06:00:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:00:220000.Dialogue: And ski. We'll also go skiing.

00:06:06:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:06:000000.Dialogue: Well, you'll ski, I'll fall, but, yeah, we will be in Switzerland for Valentine's Day.

00:06:11:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:11:030000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, Leonard! That's incredible!

00:06:14:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:14:200000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Not so fast. You might want to hold off on lighting your rabeliechtli, Penny.

00:06:21:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:21:070000.Dialogue: Rabeliechtli. It means turnip light and refers to a traditional lantern hand-carved from a root vegetable and used to celebrate certain Swiss festivals. Which you will not be celebrating because A: these festivals occur in the fall;

00:06:33:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:33:140000.Dialogue: and B: you will not be going to Switzerland.

00:06:37:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:37:170000.Dialogue: Sheldon, we've been through this. I'm taking Penny.

00:06:40:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:40:210000.Dialogue: Afraid not. Do you recognize this?

00:06:45:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:45:050000.Dialogue: Indeed, the roommate agreement. I call your attention to the Friendship Rider in Appendix C: Future Commitments. "Number 37: in the event one friend is ever invited "to visit the Large Hadron Collider, "now under construction in Switzerland, he shall invite the other friend to accompany him."

00:07:02:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:02:140000.Dialogue: You actually put that in an agreement?

00:07:05:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:05:070000.Dialogue: Yeah. We also put in what happens if one of us wins a MacArthur Grant, or if one of us gets superpowers, or if one of us is bitten by a zombie.

00:07:13:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:13:100000.Dialogue: He can't kill me, even if I turn.

00:07:16:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:16:150000.Dialogue: Is there anything in there about if one of you gets a girlfriend?

00:07:20:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:20:100000.Dialogue: No, that seemed a little farfetched.

00:07:25:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:25:130000.Dialogue: Sheldon, do you really expect to enforce this?

00:07:28:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:28:160000.Dialogue: I've lived up to all my commitments under the agreement. At least once a day I ask how you are, even though I simply don't care. I no longer stage spontaneous biohazard drills after 10:00 p.m. And I abandoned my goal to master Tuvan throat singing.

00:07:43:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:43:110000.Dialogue: Okay, I know I shouldn't ask, but what is...? No.

00:07:54:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:54:060000.Dialogue: I'd be much further along if I'd been allowed to practice.

00:07:57:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:57:180000.Dialogue: Look, Sheldon, I know it's in the agreement, and if you turn into a zombie, I promise I will not kill you. In fact, I'll even let you eat my brains. But I am taking Penny to Switzerland.

00:08:31:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:31:200000.Dialogue: Got a bit of traffic this morning, huh? Think it's gonna rain? Instead of underpants, I covered my crotch with potato salad this morning. Thoughts? Okay, I know what'll cheer you up. Let's play one of your driving games.

00:08:53:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:53:040000.Dialogue: All right. This game is called Traitors.

00:08:59:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:59:100000.Dialogue: I will name three historical figures, you put them in order of the heinousness of their betrayal. Benedict Arnold, Judas, Dr. Leonard Hofstadter.

00:09:09:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:09:060000.Dialogue: You really think I belong with Benedict Arnold and Judas?

00:09:12:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:12:180000.Dialogue: You're right. Judas had the decency to hang himself after what he did.

00:09:16:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:16:220000.Dialogue: Come on, Sheldon. Can't you at least try to understand how much this means to me?

00:09:23:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:23:000000.Dialogue: Round two: Leonard Hofstadter, Darth Vader, Rupert Murdoch.

00:09:29:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:29:220000.Dialogue: He owns Fox, and they cancelled Firefly.

00:09:34:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:34:140000.Dialogue: Hint: he and Darth Vader are tied for #2.

00:09:42:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:42:100000.Dialogue: I'm sorry I couldn't hang with you last night. I had a date with Bernadette.

00:09:46:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:46:020000.Dialogue: I know. I saw the Tweet.

00:09:49:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:49:060000.Dialogue: So, what did you end up doing?

00:09:50:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:50:190000.Dialogue: Not much. Nuked a burrito. Oh. Prayed to the Hindu god Urvashi that your bowels would loosen and your penis would droop like a willow tree.

00:10:00:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:00:150000.Dialogue: No. Is he still mad about the supercollider?

00:10:02:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:02:190000.Dialogue: Yeah. He thinks I betrayed him. I mean, come on. What would you guys do if you were me?

00:10:11:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:11:130000.Dialogue: Absolutely. And I'd leave him there.

00:10:24:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:24:070000.Dialogue: Uh, let's see. Yup, 30 pieces of silverware.

00:10:54:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:54:160000.Dialogue: I've made you breakfast. Juice, coffee, and pancakes in the shape of some of your favorite fictional characters. See, here's Frodo.

00:11:06:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:06:150000.Dialogue: Yeah, I used coconut shavings to do the hair on his feet.

00:11:09:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:09:170000.Dialogue: If you need to void your bladder before eating, I can keep them warm with this beret that I thoroughly laundered and pressed into service as a pancake cozy.

00:11:22:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:22:040000.Dialogue: It's by way of an apology for my recent behavior. I've had some time to reflect and I've come to realize that friendship is not an aggregation of written agreements. It's a result of two people respecting and caring for each other. Butterscotch scone?

00:11:43:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:43:180000.Dialogue: What you're tasting is respect and affection.

00:11:47:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:47:060000.Dialogue: And about a pound of Crisco.

00:11:50:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:50:160000.Dialogue: After you've finished breakfast, I thought we could spend the day watching the final season of Babylon 5 with director commentary.

00:11:59:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:59:080000.Dialogue: I do. It fails as drama/science fiction, and it's hopelessly derivative.

00:12:03:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:03:110000.Dialogue: But you like it, and you're my friend.

00:12:06:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:06:100000.Dialogue: Okay, great. Still not taking you to Switzerland.

00:12:29:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:29:180000.Dialogue: I believe you know why I'm here.

00:12:31:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:31:220000.Dialogue: Well, I always figured it was to study us, discover our weaknesses, and report back to your alien overlords.

00:12:39:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:39:130000.Dialogue: Yes, amusing. Extraordinary intelligence might well appear extraterrestrial to you, but let me be more specific. I believe you know why I'm here in the laundry room.

00:12:50:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:50:170000.Dialogue: Better acoustics for your throat singing?

00:13:04:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:04:030000.Dialogue: But my true purpose in being here will be revealed in this brief PowerPoint presentation. Lights.

00:13:22:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:22:030000.Dialogue: Why Sheldon Cooper, PhD, should go to Switzerland to see the CERN supercollider: a PowerPoint presentation by Sheldon Cooper, PhD.

00:13:32:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:32:210000.Dialogue: Here we have a highly gifted researcher in the field of particle physics whose work has brought him to the precipice of forever changing mankind's understanding of the universe. AKA me.

00:13:44:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:44:090000.Dialogue: And here we have a waitress brushing her teeth with her finger.

00:13:52:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:52:010000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. Is this supposed to be buttering me up?

00:13:54:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:54:150000.Dialogue: Please hold all questions to the end of the presentation. This is the Large Hadron Collider at CERN in Switzerland, the product of decades of planning and construction. It is a mecca for physicists the world over. This is Bath and Body Works on Colorado Boulevard. They sell scented soaps and lotions, some of which contain glitter. Now, let's see if we can match the individual to the appropriate destination.

00:14:24:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:24:030000.Dialogue: No, it's not. I've got five more slides.

00:14:26:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:26:200000.Dialogue: Sheldon, this is Leonard's decision. He invited me to Switzerland, and I intend to go.

00:14:35:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:35:050000.Dialogue: Very well. Enjoy yourself. You're going to be in the presence of something that I've dreamed of seeing for decades. I just hope you'll be able to appreciate the magnitude of where you are and what it represents.

00:14:57:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:57:050000.Dialogue: Yes. If it means that much to you, you should go.

00:15:07:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:07:230000.Dialogue: Since I rarely hug, I'm relying on your expertise regarding duration.

00:15:21:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:21:210000.Dialogue: You know what? Even though I don't have a girlfriend, I can still have a good time on Valentine's Day.

00:15:26:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:26:150000.Dialogue: Trust me, you can't. I've tried.

00:15:29:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:29:080000.Dialogue: No, no, no, I'm going to have a "me" day. First I'm going to go to one of those spas in Koreatown, take a steam and get a massage. Then I'm going to stop at a pet store and get licked by puppies.

00:15:43:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:43:010000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I need to talk to you.

00:15:44:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:44:190000.Dialogue: All right, my friend. Would you like some cholermus?

00:15:59:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:59:200000.Dialogue: Oh, but I am. Didn't Penny tell you the good news?

00:16:02:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:02:230000.Dialogue: She told me that you went behind my back to guilt her into letting you go instead of her.

00:16:09:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:09:160000.Dialogue: Well, forget it. I was the one who was invited. I get to decide who goes with me, and it's Penny, not you!

00:16:15:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:15:070000.Dialogue: Howard, could you lower the lights? I have a short PowerPoint presentation.

00:16:19:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:19:010000.Dialogue: I don't need to see your presentation. This discussion is over!

00:16:22:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:22:210000.Dialogue: That's a somewhat ambiguous response. Am I going or not?

00:16:27:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:27:110000.Dialogue: Sheldon, at this point, I would go by myself before I would take you.

00:16:33:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:33:210000.Dialogue: Well then, you leave me no alternative. From this moment forward, we can be roommates, but we will no longer be friends.

00:16:42:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:42:070000.Dialogue: I'm sorry you feel that way.

00:16:44:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:44:040000.Dialogue: I don't think you're fully aware of the ramifications here, Leonard. (sighs)

00:16:50:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:50:100000.Dialogue: With the friendship clause of our roommate agreement nullified you are no longer entitled to accompany me to go swimming at Bill Gates' house should I be invited.

00:17:08:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:08:200000.Dialogue: Just think, this time tomorrow we'll be in Geneva, Switzerland for our first Valentine's Day.

00:17:14:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:14:030000.Dialogue: I know! I went shopping today and bought special undies for the occasion.

00:17:30:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:30:010000.Dialogue: Gesundheit. Or as they say in Switzerland, gesundheit.

00:17:38:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:38:070000.Dialogue: No, no, it's probably just allergies.

00:17:42:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:42:150000.Dialogue: Do you want an allergy pill? 'Cause I have 'em all. Prescription, nonprescription, foreign, domestic, experimental.

00:17:50:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:50:130000.Dialogue: Not really, I’m just an enthusiast.

00:18:08:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:08:090000.Dialogue: Did that sound okay to you?

00:18:16:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:16:170000.Dialogue: I'm having a tea party. What do you think's going on?

00:18:22:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:22:140000.Dialogue: I think I might have the flu.

00:18:31:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:31:020000.Dialogue: Well, our plane leaves at 9:00 a.m. Do you think you'll feel better by then?

00:18:44:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:44:100000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon? Listen, Penny is pretty sick and she's not going to be able to go to Switzerland. So if you're still interested, you're welcome to come.

00:19:35:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:35:030000.Dialogue: Why don’t I pour it in your lap, and you can tell me.

00:19:38:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:38:140000.Dialogue: You don't have to be mean. I'm sick.

00:19:47:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:47:120000.Dialogue: I just don't understand how this happened to me. I'm scrupulous about my hygiene. I regularly disinfect my hands, and I avoid contact with other people on general principle.

00:19:58:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:58:120000.Dialogue: I don't know what to tell you, Sheldon.

00:20:30:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:20:30:220000.Dialogue: Oh, my goodness, look at this room! (gasps) Champagne! Roses! Oh! And little chocolates! This is going to be the best Valentine's Day ever.

00:20:45:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:45:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, I forgot about all this.
